name: 2012_10_humanities_student_major_1156_college
title: 2012-10-humanities-student-major_1156_college.txt
content_scrubbed:
I go to Iowa but I have a lot of friends that go to Iowa State. the biggest difference between the major state schools is who goes to them, the programs they offer, and student activities. 

Iowa offers more of a liberal_arts based education, with focuses on business, pre-law, pre-med, engineering, journalism, and writing. It[.] a ranked party school, and the average student drinks almost twice the national average of alcohol per week. It can get pretty wild. 

Iowa State is more of an engineering school, most of the people that I know who go there are there for Engineering, Architecture, or Health sciences.

Iowa state has a much larger greek life than Iowa, however at Iowa, most of the students don't participate in greek life, whereas at Iowa State, more than half of the student body is Greek. 

Iowa is a dry campus, Iowa state is not. 

I was kinda surprised when you said that there were so many students attending Iowa state, Iowa easily has more students from the chicago area than Iowa State. most of the student body of Iowa is Chicagoland area students and in state Iowans, whereas Iowa state is mostly in-state Iowans and students from minnesota, nebraska, and Missouri. 

If you want to know anything more about either school, feel free to PM me. Obviously I know more about Iowa than Iowa State, but I might be able to help anyway.
